oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dick Curless Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 1 of 2. Recording of an interview with Dick Curless (performer) about his "Closeup" album. Interview conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dick Curless; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Dick Curless begins by speaking on Smokey Rogers providing his first opportunities in Nashville -- (01:30) Curless talks about allowing free range when emanating Smokey Rogers on a recording -- (02:04) Curless talks about putting in the leg-work for a record -- (02:34) "Can't Break My Heart" is discussed as an interpretation of feelings -- (03:45) Biff Collie and Curless discuss the first time Curless heard "Can't Break My Heart" -- (04:25) Smokey Rogers, Deuce, and Tex (The Trio) is discussed -- (05:32) "Spanish Fandago" by Curless is described as a "Bruce Willis feel" -- (06:40) Collie and Curless talk about how the first half of the album is dedicated to Smokey Rogers -- (07:26) "Storms of Life" is briefly described -- (07:50) Curless talks about Gene Watson -- (08:42) "Gone" is addressed -- (08:53) Curless comments on Ricky Van Shelton's "Statue of a Fool" -- (09:26) The Baron of Bangor and other nicknames are addressed -- (10:05) "The Rice Petty Ranger" cartoon is discussed -- (10:50) "The Mississippi Blue Yodeler" nickname and Bob Wills are discussed -- (12:23) "The Father of Rivers" is expressed -- (13:30) Curless speaks on George Strait and Dennis Adkins as his writer -- (14:46) "A Part of America Died" is discussed from its poetic and patriotic roots -- (17:48) Collie and Curless radio spot tribute to Hank Thompson -- (19:21) Curless recalls first time he heard Thompson perform -- (20:02) Curless tells about finding "Maybe I should Have Been Listening" in Vermont -- (21:28) Collie and Curless talk about Jennifer O'Brian -- (21:54) Collie brings up William "Lefty" Orville Frizzell -- (23:50) "Just a Matter of Time" is discussed compared to a hotel in Maine -- (26:47) Buck Owens is joked about and Curless gives his praise -- (28:03) Curless talks about his time post-stroke and doing an album in a day -- (30:16) "Stonnin Around" and "Faded Love" are mentioned -- (30:38) Pee Wee King recitation is discussed and how Curless changed one word to nuclear -- (33:14) Curless brings up people's influences around him -- (34:22) Curless final sign off
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Curless, Dick; Collie, Biff;
